item.title: Surprise! Kingdom Come: Deliverance PS5 and Xbox Series X|S Versions Launch Today
item.content:encoded:
If you've been waiting for Kingdom Come: Deliverance to hit PS5 and Xbox Series X|S before giving it a shot, then you won't have much longer to wait. In fact, you don't have any longer to wait at all!

That's right: Kingdom Come: Deliverance is coming to current-gen consoles today, and if you already happen to own the game on PS4 or Xbox One, then you'll get a "next-gen" upgrade for free.

The upgrade will allow you to experience the game's realistic rendering of early 15th-century Bohemia at "up to 60fps", which presumably means it will come with performance and fidelity modes on the newer consoles, a feature that doesn't exist on previous-gen machines.

As well as the increased frame rate option, you'll also be able to take advantage of sharper visuals and smoother performance across the board on PS5 and Xbox Series X|S, making the current-gen versions of the game the best way to play if you're on console.

News of Kingdom Come: Deliverance's appearance on current-gen consoles comes after Warhorse and parent company Embracer announced that sequel Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2 has sold five million copies since launching last year.

The first game is no slouch in the sales department either; it's sold over ten million copies at time of writing, a figure that will no doubt increase further now that more people are able to access it.

If you're unfamiliar with Kingdom Come: Deliverance, it's an action RPG that emphasizes realism and historical accuracy over the usual dragons-and-wizards malarkey (which has its place!). The game is set in 15th-century Bohemia and follows the story of blacksmith's son Henry as he gets embroiled in political intrigue.

Kingdom Come: Deliverance is available to buy right now on PC, and it's dropping on PS5 and Xbox Series X|S today as well. Stay tuned for more, and in the meantime, why not check out our review from the halcyon days of 2018?

item.title: Dino Crisis 1 and 2 Rampage Onto Steam With a Big Discount
item.content:encoded:
The first two Dino Crisis games are now available on Steam, and if you pick them up in the next couple of weeks, you'll get a hefty discount on them as well.

Announcing the games' release on X, Capcom also revealed that until February 26th, both Dino Crisis and Dino Crisis 2 will be available at a whopping 50% off, which means you'll only be paying $5 for each game instead of $10. I reckon that's a steal.

This isn't the first time these games have been made available on modern PC hardware; back in January last year, both Dino Crisis and its sequel were released via GOG, but if you're a Steam hound who likes all of your games to be in one place, then today's your lucky day.

Just like in the GOG version, you can expect some modernizations and improvements as part of the Steam release of Dino Crisis and Dino Crisis 2, including increased rendering resolution, modern controller support with "optimal button binding", and an improved internal renderer, plus lots more.

Dino Crisis' Steam release rather puts paid to Shinji Mikami's comments about Dino Crisis no longer being relevant thanks to Monster Hunter; it seems there's room for both to exist in this storied world of ours.

These re-releases are nice on their own, but it's even more tantalizing to imagine that they might represent a revival for the Dino Crisis franchise as a whole. Perhaps that long-awaited Dino Crisis remake might finally materialize now? Wishful thinking, I know, but let me dream, eh?

If you're not familiar with Dino Crisis, the first game is a survival horror experience akin to Resident Evil (but with dinosaurs, of course), while the second takes a more action-oriented approach with nods to arcade scoring and other more high-octane mechanics.

You can check out Dino Crisis on Steam here, and Dino Crisis 2 is available right here. Stay tuned for more.
